Description: Date on which body mass measurements, tarsus length measurements and blood samples were collected from each nestling
Bird identity - from one metal band (M) and three colour bands with a unique letter code per colour
Group identity - Pied babblers are cooperatively breeding birds that live in groups
Breeding season - coded using a letter since the inception of the project with the first breeding season where the population was monitored labelled as 'A'
Age in days sine hatching on the day when body mass measurements, tarsus length measurements and blood samples were collected from each nestling
Sex detemined from blood samples using molecular sexing techniques

Nest identity - code is composed of Group identity (3 letters), the letter "N" for nest, a number designating the order of nest where 1 = first nest of the season, and a letter designating the breeding season
Composite term - Bird identity + Season
Number of adults (individuals older than one year) in the natal group
Number of immature birds (fledged individuals younger than one year) in the natal group
Total number of birds in the group
Date 60 days prior to the start of incubation for the nest in which the nestling hatched
Date of initiation of incubation for the nest in which the nestling hatched
Date on which the nestling hatched
Date on which the nestling fledged; blank if died before fledging
Date on which the nest failed if the nestling did not fledge; blank if the nestling fledged
Date 90 days after hatching, when pied babblers are ore or less fully grown and nutritionally independent
Date 365 days after hatching, when pied babblers are considered sexually mature
Date 730 days after hatching - pied babblers often disperse around this age
Number of nestlings in the brood on the measurement day
Number of male nestlings in the brood on the measurement day
Ratio of male to female nestlings in the brood on the measurement day
Number of nestlings in the brood on the measurement day that survived to fledge
Number of male nestlings in the brood on the measurement day that survived to fledge
Number of nestlings in the brood on the measurement day that survived to nutritional independence at 90 days
Number of male nestlings in the brood on the measurement day that survived to nutritional independence at 90 days
Body mass to 0.1g on the measurement day
Left tarsus length in cm on the measurement day
Right tarsus length in cm on the measurement day
Right tarsus length in mm on the measurement day
Difference between left and right tarsus length in cm on the measurement day
Whether or not any of the nestlings in the brood fledged where YES=at least one nestling from the brood fledged, NO = the nest failed
Whether or not the nestling survived to fledge where 1 = fledged, 0 = did not fledge
Whether or not the nestling survived to 90 days of age where 1 = survived, 0 = did not survive
Body mass to 0.1g 90+-15 days after hatching
Difference between Mass at 90 days and nestling mass
Proportional change in mass between Mass at 90 days and nestling mass
Whether or not the nestling survived to 1 year of age where 1 = survived, 0 = did not survive
Body mass to 0.1g 365 +- 15 days after hatching
Whether or not the bird still lives in its natal group where 1 = Yes and 0 = No
Maximum ambient air temperature on the measurement day, recorded by an on-site weather station
Whether the Tmax measurement was above (Hot) or below (cool) 35.5 degrees C
Average daily maximum ambient air temperature between the start of incubation and hatching, recorded by an on-site weather station
Average daily maximum ambient air temperature between hatching and fledging, recorded by an on-site weather station
Average daily maximum ambient air temperature between the start of incubation and fledging, recorded by an on-site weather station
Average daily maximum ambient air temperature between fledging and nutritional independence, recorded by an on-site weather station
Minimum ambient air temperature on the measurement day, recorded by an on-site weather station
Average daily minimum ambient air temperature between the start of incubation and hatching, recorded by an on-site weather station
Average daily minimum ambient air temperature between hatching and fledging, recorded by an on-site weather station
Average daily minimum ambient air temperature between the start of incubation and fledging, recorded by an on-site weather station
Average daily minimum ambient air temperature between fledging and nutritional independence, recorded by an on-site weather station
Difference between minimum and maximum ambient air temperature on the measurement day, recorded by an on-site weather station
Average difference between minimum and maximum ambient air temperature between the start of incubation and hatching, recorded by an on-site weather station
Average difference between minimum and maximum  ambient air temperature between hatching and fledging, recorded by an on-site weather station
Averagedifference between minimum and maximum  ambient air temperature between the start of incubation and fledging, recorded by an on-site weather station
Average difference between minimum and maximum  ambient air temperature between fledging and nutritional independence, recorded by an on-site weather station
Whether or not there was a heat wave (3 consecutive days above 35.5 degrees C) between the start of incubation and hatching,where 1=yes and 0=no
Number of times between the start of incubation and hatching that there were two days in row above 35.5 degrees C
Number of discretes heats waves (3 consecutive days above 35.5 degrees C) between the start of incubation and hatching
Total number hot days (above 35.5 degrees C) between the start of incubation and hatching
Proportion of hot days (above 35.5 degrees C) between the start of incubation and hatching
Whether or not there was a heat wave (3 consecutive days above 35.5 degrees C) between the hatching and fledging,where 1=yes and 0=no
Number of times between hatching and fledging that there were two days in row above 35.5 degrees C
Number of discretes heats waves (3 consecutive days above 35.5 degrees C) between hatching and fledging
Total number hot days (above 35.5 degrees C) between hatching and fledging
Proportion of hot days (above 35.5 degrees C) between hatching and fledging
Whether or not there was a heat wave (3 consecutive days above 35.5 degrees C) between the start of incubation and fledging,where 1=yes and 0=no
Number of times between the start of incubation and fledging that there were two days in row above 35.5 degrees C
Number of discretes heats waves (3 consecutive days above 35.5 degrees C) between the start of incubation and fledging
Total number hot days (above 35.5 degrees C) between the start of incubation and fledging
Proportion of hot days (above 35.5 degrees C) between the start of incubation and fledging
Total number hot days (above 35.5 degrees C) between fledging and nutritional independence
Proportion of hot days (above 35.5 degrees C) between fledging and nutritional independence
Total rainfall in the 60 days prior to the initiation of incubation
Total rainfall between fledging and nutritional independence
Total rainfall between 60 days prior to the initiation of incubation and nutritional independence
Whether or not the season was categorised as a drought (75% of average rainfall over the preceding 30 years), where 1 = drought, 0 = no drought
